intro: Tripterospermum japonicum var. tenue, commonly known as the slender Japanese tripterospermum, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely distributed outside its native range.
